news_header: Belarus President Lukashenka pardons 15 prisoners, including those convicted of terrorism and drug trafficking.
news_text: Alyaksandr Lukashenka, the autocratic President of Belarus, has pardoned 15 prisoners, including eight convicted of terrorism and seven for drug trafficking, according to the state news agency Belle. Lukashenka, who has been in power for over 30 years, is expected to win the upcoming election. He has a history of suppressing opposition and is criticized in the West for human rights violations.
